items.title: USA Road Trip - Post #6
items.summary: We were up early this morning - with the time change we are waking up about 5am. We had breakfast in the hotel and then headed for the meeting in Sun River, a small town about 20 minutes from Great Falls. The meeting is comprised…
items.content_html:
We were up early this morning - with the time change we are waking up about 5am.  We had breakfast in the hotel and then headed for the meeting in Sun River, a small town about 20 minutes from Great Falls.  The meeting is comprised of a number of people who have left Hutterite colonies in the area along with some others, and lots of kids!  Joe and Penny Clark kindly invited us to their place for lunch.  They live on the top of a hill above the town, with fields and blue sky all around.

We left their house about 2:30 to head back to Great Falls.  A beautiful drive - horses, cattle, some sheep...

The scenery here is spectacular everywhere...

Back at our hotel, I had a nap, and then we walked over to the grocery store next door to get some supplies for tomorrow, as well as something for supper tonight, although we don't need much after a big lunch.  We hope to make an early start tomorrow for the drive through Glacier National Park.

items.title: USA Road Trip - Post #5
items.summary: No shopping today - we were on the road by 9 am. We headed out on the I-94 West and took the exit for 200S North towards Great Falls. This is a two-lane road with the occasional passing lane. Here the speed limit was only…
items.content_html:
No shopping today - we were on the road by 9 am.  We headed out on the I-94 West and took the exit for 200S North towards Great Falls.  This is a two-lane road with the occasional passing lane.  Here the speed limit was only 70 mph!  Quite varied landscape ranging from rolling hills, to rocky desert-like gullies to flat plains with hills off on the horizon.

They have several rest areas along the way with a place to pull off, a picnic table or two, and restrooms.

We saw lots of cattle on the hills, several ranches, and the occasional cowboy on horseback!

We arrived in Great Falls around 3:30pm.  It was nice to get into our hotel before supper and be able to relax a little.  Driving 5-6 hours a day doesn't sound like much but when you do it day after day it becomes tiring!  We plan to stay here in Great Falls tonight (Saturday night) as well as Sunday night.  Tomorrow we plan to go the breaking of bread in Sun River, about 20 minutes away.  Joe and Penny Clark have kindly invited us for lunch after the meeting there.  Monday we plan to drive through Glacier National Park on the "Going to the Sun" road which winds through the park.

items.title: USA Road Trip - Post #4
items.summary: This morning after breakfast at the hotel, we headed to TJ Maxx - a store sort of like Winners in Canada, but nicer. Janet found some pairs of shoes that she really liked along with a few other things. Then we headed west once again…
items.content_html:
This morning after breakfast at the hotel, we headed to TJ Maxx - a store sort of like Winners in Canada, but nicer.  Janet found some pairs of shoes that she really liked along with a few other things.  Then we headed west once again on the I-94.  We were passing through Bismarck, North Dakota and I noticed there was a Hobby Lobby there so we stopped.  Janet did some shopping there and at Joanne's Fabrics, and I had a lovely nap in the van.  After some lunch, we headed back on the road.  The landscape became more hilly, and then we came to Theodore Roosevelt National Park and decided to stop and check it out.  It is unlike anything I've ever seen - a sort of badlands with rocky outcropings and gullies running through it.

There is a scenic drive you can take through the park, so we paid the entrance fee and drove in.  It was well-worth it - spectacular scenery!  

We came across some bison - one of which was on the road - they are huge animals!

We drove up to Buck's Peak in the park - it is a short climb to the top to be able to see for miles.

Driving back to the highway we passed some horseback riders...

Then we drove on and crossed the state line into Montana.  The speed limit here is 80 mph (130 kph)!  I ended up driving 120-125 - it just feels too weird to be driving 130!  We got to our spot for the night - Glendive Montana - a small town where we will leave the I-94 tomorrow and head northwest to Great Falls Montana.

items.title: USA Road Trip - Post #3
items.summary: This morning we woke up to a chlly 4 degrees in Duluth. We are enjoying breakfast - the Fairfield Inn has a good one and even Janet is getting into oatmeal, especially when you have lots of choices for toppings.... We headed over the mall…
items.content_html:
This morning we woke up to a chlly 4 degrees in Duluth.  We are enjoying breakfast - the Fairfield Inn has a good one and even Janet is getting into oatmeal, especially when you have lots of choices for toppings....

We headed over the mall across the street at 10 am when it opened and browsed through a huge Barnes and Noble bookstore.  Their bibles section is quite a bit larger than what you would see in Ottawa!

Then we visited a very large shoe warehouse and Janet and I each got a pair.  We picked up a couple of croissants at a nearby Panera Bread, and after a quick lunch in the van we were on the road west again.

As we left Minnesota and headed into North Dakota, the countryside flattened out and it felt a lot like the Canadian prairies - big expanses of open sky and the interstate running as straight as an arrow for miles.  The speed limit is 75 mph (120 kph) - for construction zones it drops to 65 mph (105 kph)!  At that speed you make pretty good time.  We passed Fargo North Dakota and eventually reached our destination for tonight - Jamestown North Dakota.  Just before our turnoff, I saw a sign saying we had crossed the continental divide - so from here on waterways flow west to the Pacific ocean.  

We checked in to our hotel, and then headed out for a quick supper at Taco John's followed by dessert at Dairy Queen.  We have about 10 hours from here to make it to Great Falls Montana by Saturday night - so roughly 5 hours of driving Friday and Saturday.  We plan to be at the meeting in nearby Sun River on Sunday.

items.title: USA Road Trip - Post #2
items.summary: We had a leisurely breakfast in the hotel this morning because we wanted to stop by Scripture Gift and Book Shop which doesn't open until 10 am. The current owner was surprised to learn that Janet was Margaret Frizelle's granddaughter and worked in the store…
items.content_html:
We had a leisurely breakfast in the hotel this morning because we wanted to stop by Scripture Gift and Book Shop which doesn't open until 10 am.  The current owner was surprised to learn that Janet was Margaret Frizelle's granddaughter and worked in the store during high school.  We had a nice visit with her - she and her husband really seem to enjoy running the store.  They have a nice selection of books and they managed to stay afloat during the pandemic by setting up an online store and having curbside pickup.  

Then we headed for the bridge to the USA - a very short wait at the border - the US customs lady was very friendly, and surprised to learn we were driving to California!

Soon we were across and into Michigan, and we headed west across the Upper Peninsula towards Duluth.  After driving for quite a while through what seemed a very remote area with no towns, stores or gas stations, I suddenly realized we were very nearly out of gas.  The van has a big tank - the last fill up was near Renfrew yesterday, and I had meant to fill up in the Soo this morning but forgot!  Google maps showed that fortunately a gas station was just 7 miles ahead - we landed there with our gauge showing a range of 22 km left which is too close for comfort - not sure how accurate it is and I don't want to find out!

After filling up the tank and having lunch, we drove on.  We stopped at the little lakeside town of Munising, Michigan on the south shore of Lake Superior - really pretty spot.

Further on we came to beautiful sand beaches with big rolling waves...

Even though we started later in the day, it seemed like a long day of driving.  We ended up switching up drivers a few times.   We were on two-lane highways rather than interstate highways so that makes it more interesting driving.  Similar to highway 17, they have passing lanes every so often and the speed limit is 65 mph most of the time.  Finally we pulled into Duluth around 7:30pm - the time is an hour earlier here so it's 6:30 Minnesota time.   The last time we were in Duluth was 31 years ago, just after we were married - we did the Great Circle Route around Superior - Sault Ste. Marie to Thunder Bay to Duluth and then back to the Soo along the south side of Lake Superior.  

There is a mall across from our hotel so we headed over there for a burger at Five Guys - will check out the mall tomorrow as there is a huge Barnes and Noble store :).

items.title: USA Road Trip  - Post #1
items.summary: We finished packing this morning and left 874 Clearcrest just before 9am. We thought rush hour would be over in Ottawa but not so - took a while to make it through the city. Light misty rain falling as we left the city. The skies…
items.content_html:
We finished packing this morning and left 874 Clearcrest just before 9am.  We thought rush hour would be over in Ottawa but not so - took a while to make it through the city.  Light misty rain falling as we left the city.

The skies cleared as we headed northwest along highway 17 towards Renfrew.  We had a brief stop for gas in Cobden and then carried on to a roadside stop near Mattawa - we've stopped here several times when heading to Thunder Bay.  It is a nice quiet spot to have lunch.

After lunch Janet drove and I had a nap.  North Bay, Sturgeon Falls, Sudbury... we stopped in Blind River for an ice cap at Tim Hortons... and then on to the Soo.  We got to our hotel on the Great Northern Road around 7pm - checked in and noticed that Giovanni's almost across the street, so walked over there for supper.

  Giovanni's was right full - a busy place on a Tuesday night!  We walked back to the hotel very full.  Tomorrow we hope to visit the christian book shop where Janet worked with her grandmother back in high school, and then cross over into the US and head for Duluth!

items.title: Battle Island 2022 - Day 5/6 - Home again!
items.summary: We said goodbye to Bruce and Eric on Thursday morning and were on the road around 9:15 headed east. We stopped in Schreiber for coffee at a Robin's Donut shop there (not much else!) and drove on towards the Soo. We had lunch at Subway…
items.content_html:
We said goodbye to Bruce and Eric on Thursday morning and were on the road around 9:15 headed east.  We stopped in Schreiber for coffee at a Robin's Donut shop there (not much else!) and drove on towards the Soo.  We had lunch at Subway in Wawa, and were in the Soo by 3:30 and stopped for gas there.

I'm always surprised at how little civilization there seems to be on the north shore of Lake Superior - small towns here and there, but mostly miles of trees and rocks, with the occasional abandoned motel or service centre.  Mitch drove from the Soo to Blind River and then I drove to Sudbury.  We arrived there around 7:30, got some supper and stopped at Dairy Queen for ice cream.  A very nice hotel there - we were in bed by 10pm.  

Up at 7 the next morning, breakfast in our hotel and on the road by 8am.  Amy drove to North Bay, and then I drove from there.  We pulled into Amy's place around 2pm and dropped them off and then home to 874 Clearcrest.  Nice to travel but nice to be home again!  And thankful for many miles safely travelled.

The crew at Battle Island will be packing up today - looks like nice weather for it.  They'll be a tired bunch tonight for sure!  It looks like they did get the lighthouse painted and it looks great!  Below are some pictures Nick and Eric took of the lighthouse and group.

items.title: Battle Island 2022 - Day 4
items.summary: A beautiful day with the sun burning the fog off the water. Lucy and I drove to Schrieber to pick up some milk for the camp and got coffee and brought it back to the Willows. We headed for the island around 10 am and…
items.content_html:
A beautiful day with the sun burning the fog off the water.  Lucy and I drove to Schrieber to pick up some milk for the camp and got coffee and brought it back to the Willows.  We headed for the island around 10 am and checked in with Mitch and Amy at their tent.  They had a good night although a little chilly.  Mitch, along with Caitlin and Mr. Stieh made pancakes for everyone.

Lots of activity today with various work projects underway - painting the workshop and also painting the lighthouse!

Mitch, Amy and I took the canoe out for a spin around part of the island.

For supper we had potatoes baked over the fire and chicken on the barbeque - it was delicious!  

We had a campfire to keep warm while waiting for the fireworks as it drops cooler at night.  We sang a few hymns with Chris on the guitar.

Finally around 11 it was time for fireworks!

Then we headed out in the boat with Eric back to the Willows Inn - arriving around midnight!  Glad to see our beds!

items.title: Battle Island 2022 - Day 3
items.summary: It was lightly raining this am and very foggy. We checked out of our cabin and met up with Eric at the dock at 11 am. Soon we were on our way to the island amidst the fog. It was still misty and raining when…
items.content_html:
It was lightly raining this am and very foggy.  We checked out of our cabin and met up with Eric at the dock at 11 am.  Soon we were on our way to the island amidst the fog.

It was still misty and raining when we landed and headed up to the house.  It was nice to see Christopher and meet Allison and Jack and Calvin for the first time!  I think they had a bit of a wet night with the rain and a leaky tent!

Mitch and Amy set up their tent on the beach - should be a nice view.

Lots of kids running around enjoying the freedom of going whereever they want.  We were hoping the rain would stop and the skies would clear.

The day gradually cleared and by afternoon the sun was shining - nice for everyone to get their tents dried out.  We climbed up into the lighthouse and enjoyed the panoramic view of the island.

As always the kids enjoy checking out all the rocks and the shoreline.

The kids have fun playing together and grabbing snacks from the house.

Mitch and Janet spent some time with little Madeline!  She is very happy and content!

The EDC board gave me a cowboy hat when I was in Calgary - it looks better on Janet than me and keeps the sun off!

You can see Victoria and the two Nicks in this picture, along with Chris on the right.  The woman standing is Gabriel Ranta - friends of Lucy and Bruce who came along with their four kids. 

Mitch and I climbed to a rocky outcrop that overlooks the house and the lighthouse.

We headed back with Eric and Lucy around 9pm to the Willows bed and breakfast inn for the night - enjoyed the day but quite happy to not be tenting!

items.title: Battle Island 2022 - Day 2
items.summary: We had breakfast in the hotel and then headed out, with stops at the grocery store to get some things for lunch and supper tonight, and at Mark's WorkWearhouse to get a fleece for Janet and hats for Amy and I. Beautiful drive north of…
items.content_html:
We had breakfast in the hotel and then headed out, with stops at the grocery store to get some things for lunch and supper tonight, and at Mark's WorkWearhouse to get a fleece for Janet and hats for Amy and I.  Beautiful drive north of Sault Ste Marie, overcast but no rain yet.  We stopped at Old Woman Bay for lunch on the beach.

Then we drove on, with a quick stop in Wawa at Tims.  As we got closer to Rossport, light rain began to fall.  We pulled in to the Rossport Inn and Cabins, and settled in to our cabin for the night.  We had the largest cabin which has a cute kitchen with everything needed for meals.  It is rustic, but everything is clean and functional!  The train tracks are about 30 feet from our window so we'll hear that later tonight for sure!

After supper, Mitch and I walked down to the dock and met up with Bruce there who had just come back from the island for the night with Eric.  Eric was doing some emails at the Willows Inn and then heading back out before it got too dark.  We arranged to meet at the dock mid-morning tomorrow.
